https://wiki.ubuntu.com/WebBrowsingSlowI: I just bought the motherboard and the Ethernet is OnBoard. It *should* support IPv6, just as the router *should* support it.

it has nothing to do with your router or your network card, in fact, the protocol doesn't work on that layer. The problem is, most DNS servers do not support ipv6, so when you try to query a domain in firefox, it will query using ipv6, then time out, then query using ipv4. That's why it takes time to "look up" domains.
if you disable ipv6, this lag will go away.
Ah. The wiki made it sound like the hardware being outdated being the problem.
So, basically, the DNS I'm trying to query doesn't support the protocol and that's why it times out?
technically, your the server is only listening on ipv4, not ipv6 addresess, but your analogy is correct.
Aye. Thanks for the troubleshooting. I'll reboot and see if that did it. ;)
your windows box probably have the dns lookups cached. Could be an issue with your dns servers. Can you dig the domain without problems?

digging yahoo.com on Ubuntu works fine.
yet Firefox times out on look up
and you sure you disabled ipv6 in firefox?
